events.message: The customer reported a car accident that occurred last night, involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to the passenger vehicle collision details provided.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer through the claims process and answer their questions.
The customer received acknowledgment that the claim was successfully logged and the investigation would commence shortly.
The claims department requested copies of the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and the customer’s driver’s license for verification.
The customer uploaded all requested documents, including the police report and detailed images of the damaged car parts.
The investigation team began reviewing the incident, assessing the extent of damages and verifying the accuracy of submitted documents.
After thorough examination, the investigation report was finalized, confirming the circumstances and liability of the vehicle collision.
A settlement offer was proposed to the customer, covering repair costs and any applicable loss of use reimbursement.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the quick response and help provided during the claim process.
The claim was officially approved following the customer's acceptance of the settlement proposal including all repair expenses.
The insurance company issued the payment to the repair shop and to the customer for additional covered expenses.
With payment processed and repairs underway, the claim was closed successfully marking the end of this case.
The entire claim file including all documents and correspondence was archived for future reference and audit compliance.
